page.title: 18Trades and Crafts,Stevington
page.content: There is no real factory employment in Stevington.However there is a man who builds and repairs organs,harpsichords and spinets,often using local grown wood.His workshop is a disused chapel. A former barn is now a repair shop for washing machines.There is a hairdressing salon in the village and two local farmers are agents for wood-burning and straw burning stoves. One hundred years ago there were one hundred and sixty lace makers but now just a few senior citizens carry on the tradition.A retired resident is rebuilding a 1936 Riley Lynx and another has a collection of invalid carriages,motor-bikes and veteran cars which are occasionally shown to the public.Many ladies have taken up canvas embroidery work and have refurnished the church with beautiful hassocks.
